title: How Many Calories Are in Fruit?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in fruit per 100g serving, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, and fat breakdowns for common fresh fruits like apples and bananas.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Fruit?
assumptions: Average mixed fresh fruit (e.g., apples, bananas, berries); raw, no added sugar or processing.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fruit type, ripeness, variety, and preparation; values are averages—check specific labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of mixed fresh fruit typically contains about 60 kcal, mostly from natural sugars.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison to packaged fruit products.

tweaks.label: Dried fruit (e.g., raisins) instead of fresh

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of fruit?
faqs.a: Approximately 60 kcal for mixed fresh fruit.

faqs.q: Which fruits are lowest in calories?
faqs.a: Watermelon and strawberries are around 30-40 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: Do all fruits have the same calories?
faqs.a: No—bananas (~89 kcal/100g) are higher than apples (~52 kcal/100g).

faqs.q: How much fiber is in fruit?
faqs.a: About 2g per 100g on average, aiding digestion.
Mostly natural sugars (around 10g per 100g), but with fiber to slow absorption.
